page.title: 18A SHOPKEEPER'S LOT - S.ALDIS
page.content: In 1981 we travelled Norfolk looking for a village shop/post office & found this one;no-one could ask for a nicer village shop-ASHWELLTHORPE is lucky to have such a large one.It's a continual {struggle to keep P.O.busy enough so it {isn't closed by P.O.hierarchy who also {say,with all the recent break-ins,that {small P.O.s pose security risks.}Peo- ple's pensions/family allowances can now be paid to their banks- but this is backbone of small P.O.s'work.{Vill- {gers meet up in shop, also people from {other villages, providing company & a {listening ear & wide-ranging discuss- {ion!}Ash. is more & more a commuter village - people work & shop in city; younger generation think the best only comes from supermarkets.{In years to {come will there be a shop here? Other {villages around here have lost theirs, {let's hope Ash. doesn't.}Sheila Aldis
